Detailed Description

(blackadder Core) Stolen by Click's bitvector. Can now directly access the _data value and print it

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef uint32_t BABitvector::data_word_type

Data word type.

Bitvectors are stored as arrays of data words, each containing data_word_bits bits. For special purposes it may be faster or easier to manipulate data words directly.

const data_word_type* BABitvector::data_words (  )  const [inline]

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

BABitvector::Bit BABitvector::force_bit ( int  i  )  [inline]

Return the bit at position i, extending if necessary.

If i >= size(), then the BABitvector is resize()d to length i+1, which adds false bits to fill out the vector.

Precondition:
0 <= i
Postcondition:
i < size()
bool BABitvector::nonzero_intersection ( const BABitvector &  x  )  const

Return whether this BABitvector and x have a common true bit.

This BABitvector and x may have different sizes; the smaller is used.

void BABitvector::offset_or ( const BABitvector &  x,
int  offset 
)

Modify this BABitvector by bitwise or with an offset x.

Parameters:
x bitwise or operand
offset initial offset
Precondition:
offset >= 0 && offset + x.size() <= size()

Logically shifts x to start at position offset, then performs a bitwise or. a.offset_or(b, offset) is equivalent to: 

 for (int i = 0; i < b.size(); ++i)
     a[offset+i] |= b[i];
BABitvector::operator unspecified_bool_type (  )  const [inline]

Return true iff the BABitvector's bits are all false.

See also:
zero()

BABitvector BABitvector::operator- ( const BABitvector &  x  )  const [inline]

Return the bitwise subtraction of two bitvectors.

Precondition:
x.size() == size()

x - y is equivalent to x & ~y.

BABitvector & BABitvector::operator-= ( const BABitvector &  x  )  [inline]

Modify this BABitvector by bitwise subtraction with x.

Precondition:
x.size() == size()
Returns:
*this

Equivalent to *this &= ~x.

void BABitvector::or_with_difference ( const BABitvector &  x,
BABitvector &  difference 
)

Modify this BABitvector by bitwise or, returning difference.

Parameters:
x bitwise or operand
[out] difference set to (x - old *this)
Precondition:
x.size() == size()
Postcondition:
difference.size() == size()
x | *this == *this
(difference & *this & x) == difference

Same as operator|=, but additionally preserves any change in this BABitvector. Any newly set bits are returned in difference.

void BABitvector::resize ( int  n  )  [inline]

Resize the BABitvector to n bits.

Precondition:
n >= 0

Any bits added to the BABitvector are false.
